title: 3Sum
description:
Given an integer array `nums`, return all the **unique triplets** `[nums[i], nums[j], nums[k]]` such that `i != j`, `i != k`, and `j != k`, and `nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] == 0`.

The solution set must not contain duplicate triplets. Return triplets in any order, but each triplet must be sorted.

examples.explanation: The distinct triplets that sum to zero.
No three numbers sum to zero.
